Sentencas: An innovative and cost-efficient method of coproduction of electricity and ammonia through solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) by implementing a transition metal nitride (MnxNy) catalyst on the fuel electrode is the focus of the work.
Titulo: Heterogeneous Catalyst-Modified Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells for Simultaneous Ammonia Synthesis and Energy Conversion

Sentencas: Breaking molecular nitrogen (N equivalent to N) with a simultaneous enhancement in the electrochemical performance of the Ni-ScSZ-supported-SOFC was achieved by using transition metal nitride (Mn4N) catalysts on the fuel electrode.
Titulo: Heterogeneous Catalyst-Modified Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells for Simultaneous Ammonia Synthesis and Energy Conversion

Sentencas: Ex situ X-ray diffraction and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy revealed the chemical stability of the MnxNy catalyst under H-2 and N-2 atmospheres under cell operating conditions.
Titulo: Heterogeneous Catalyst-Modified Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells for Simultaneous Ammonia Synthesis and Energy Conversion

Sentencas: The nitrogen reduction reaction (NRR) at the Mn4N active sites was measured via hydrogenation of lattice nitrogen and formation of metallic Mn followed by renitrification of the catalyst.
Titulo: Heterogeneous Catalyst-Modified Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells for Simultaneous Ammonia Synthesis and Energy Conversion

Sentencas: Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy analysis of the catalyst-modified cell revealed improved hydrogen oxidation reaction activity and NRR during cell operation.
Titulo: Heterogeneous Catalyst-Modified Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells for Simultaneous Ammonia Synthesis and Energy Conversion

Sentencas: The cell exhibited peak power densities of 539 and 374 mW center dot cm(-2) for humidified (3 wt %) H-2 and a dry N-2/H-2 (1:1) mixture, respectively.
Titulo: Heterogeneous Catalyst-Modified Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells for Simultaneous Ammonia Synthesis and Energy Conversion

Sentencas: Furthermore, a high rate of ammonia production of 1.63 x 10(-9) mol center dot cm(-2)center dot s(-1) and a power density of 348 mW center dot cm(-2) were achieved when the cell was operated at 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Heterogeneous Catalyst-Modified Anode in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells for Simultaneous Ammonia Synthesis and Energy Conversion
